pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:0.5.eng: 33. The training rule on eating a meal before another

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood near Vesālī,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena vesāliyaṃ paṇītānaṃ bhattānaṃ bhattapaṭipāṭi adhiṭṭhitā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.2.eng: a succession of fine meals had been arranged in Vesālī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.3.pli: Atha kho aññatarassa daliddassa kammakārassa etadahosi—“na kho idaṃ orakaṃ bhavissati yathayime manussā sakkaccaṃ bhattaṃ karonti; yannūnāhampi bhattaṃ kareyyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.3.eng: A certain poor worker thought, “Why don’t I prepare a meal? It must be really worthwhile, seeing as these people prepare a meal with such respect.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.4.pli: Atha kho so daliddo kammakāro yena kirapatiko tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā taṃ kirapatikaṃ etadavoca—“icchāmahaṃ, ayyaputta, buddhappamukhassa bhikkhusaṅghassa bhattaṃ kātuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.4.eng: He then went to his boss Kira and said, “Sir, I wish to prepare a meal for the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.6.pli: Sopi kho kirapatiko saddho hoti pasanno.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.6.eng: Because Kira also had faith and confidence,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.7.pli: Atha kho so kirapatiko tassa daliddassa kammakārassa abbhātirekaṃ vetanaṃ adāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.7.eng: he gave the worker his salary and much extra.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.8.pli: Atha kho so daliddo kammakāro yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so daliddo kammakāro bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.8.eng: Soon afterwards that worker went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down, and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.9.pli: “adhivāsetu me, bhante, bhagavā svātanāya bhattaṃ saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.9.eng: “Sir, please accept a meal from me tomorrow together with the Sangha of monks.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.12.pli: Bahū me badarā paṭiyattā badaramissena peyyā paripūrissantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.12.eng: I’ve prepared much jujube, supplemented with jujube drinks.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.13.eng: The Buddha consented by remaining silent, and the worker understood.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.14.pli: Atha kho so daliddo kammakāro bhagavato adhivāsanaṃ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.14.eng: He got up from his seat, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.15.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū—“daliddena kira kammakārena svātanāya buddhappamukho bhikkhusaṅgho nimantito, badaramissena peyyā paripūrissantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.15.eng: The monks heard that a poor worker had invited the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha on the following day for a meal supplemented with jujube drinks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.16.eng: And so they ate in the morning after walking for alms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.17.pli: Assosuṃ kho manussā—“daliddena kira kammakārena buddhappamukho bhikkhusaṅgho nimantito”ti. Te daliddassa kammakārassa pahūtaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ abhihariṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.17.eng: When people heard that a poor worker had invited the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha for a meal, they brought much food of various kinds to him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.18.pli: Atha kho so daliddo kammakāro tassā rattiyā accayena paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṃ ārocāpesi—“kālo, bhante, niṭṭhitaṃ bhattan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.18.eng: The following morning that worker prepared his food, and then had the Buddha informed that the meal was ready.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.19.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena tassa daliddassa kammakārassa nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghena.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.19.eng: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe and, together with the Sangha of monks, went to the house of that poor worker where he sat down on the prepared seat in the dining hall.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.20.pli: Atha kho so daliddo kammakāro bhattagge bhikkhū parivisati. Bhikkhū evamāhaṃsu—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.20.eng: The worker served the monks, but they kept saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.22.pli: “Mā kho tumhe, bhante, ‘ayaṃ daliddo kammakāro’ti thokaṃ thokaṃ paṭiggaṇhittha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.22.eng: “Venerables, don’t accept so little because you think I’m just a poor worker.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.23.eng: I’ve prepared much food of various kinds.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.24.eng: Please accept as much as you like.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.25.pli: “Na kho mayaṃ, āvuso, etaṅkāraṇā thokaṃ thokaṃ paṭiggaṇhāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.25.eng: “We’re not accepting so little because of that,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.26.pli: Api ca, mayaṃ kālasseva piṇḍāya caritvā bhuñjimhā; tena mayaṃ thokaṃ thokaṃ paṭiggaṇhāmā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.26.eng: but because we ate in the morning after walking for alms.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.27.pli: Atha kho so daliddo kammakāro ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.27.eng: That poor worker complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.28.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhadantā mayā nimantitā aññatra bhuñjissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.28.eng: “How could the venerables eat elsewhere when invited by me?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.29.eng: Am I not able to give as much as they need?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.30.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tassa daliddassa kammakārassa ujjhāyantassa khiyyantassa vipācentassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.30.eng: The monks heard the complaints of that worker,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.31.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.31.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.32.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhū aññatra nimantitā aññatra bhuñjissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.32.eng: “How could those monks eat elsewhere when invited for a meal?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.33.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū aññatra nimantitā aññatra bhuñjantī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.33.eng: “Is it true, monks, that monks did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.36.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā aññatra nimantitā aññatra bhuñjissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.36.eng: “How could those foolish men do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.38.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.38.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.39.1.eng: ‘If a monk eats a meal before another, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.40.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.40.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu gilāno hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards a certain monk became sick.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.2.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu piṇḍapātaṃ ādāya yena so bhikkhu tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—“bhuñjāhi, āvuso”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.2.eng: Another monk took some almsfood, went to that monk, and told him to eat it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.4.pli: Tassa bhikkhuno piṇḍapāto ussūre āharīyittha. So bhikkhu na cittarūpaṃ bhuñji.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.4.eng: But since that almsfood only arrived at midday, that monk did not get to eat as much as he had intended.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.6.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.7.eng: “Monks, I allow a sick monk to eat a meal before another.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.8.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.8.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.9.1.eng: ‘If a monk eats a meal before another, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.10.eng: This is the appropriate occasion: he is sick.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.11.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.11.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā cīvaradānasamaye sacīvarabhattaṃ paṭiyādetvā bhikkhū nimantenti—“bhojetvā cīvarena acchādessāmā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.1.eng: Soon afterwards, during the robe-giving season, people prepared a meal together with robe-cloth and then invited the monks, saying, “We wish to offer a meal and give robe-cloth.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.2.eng: But knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating a meal before another and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.3.eng: As a result, they only got a small amount of robe-cloth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.5.eng: “Monks, I allow you to eat a meal before another during the robe-giving season.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.6.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.6.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.7.1.eng: ‘If a monk eats a meal before another, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.8.pli: Tatthāyaṃ samayo. Gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo—ayaṃ tattha samayo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.8.eng: These are the appropriate occasions: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.9.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.9.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.10.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā cīvarakārake bhikkhū bhattena nimantenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.10.1.eng: Soon afterwards people invited the robe-making monks for a meal.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.11.eng: But knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating a meal before another and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.13.eng: “Monks, I allow you to eat a meal before another at a time when you are making robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.14.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.14.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.15.1.eng: ‘If a monk eats a meal before another, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.16.pli: Tatthāyaṃ samayo. Gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo—ayaṃ tattha samayo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.16.eng: These are the appropriate occasions: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.17.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.17.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:4.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya āyasmatā ānandena pacchāsamaṇena yena aññataraṃ kulaṃ tenupasaṅkami;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:4.1.eng: Soon afterwards, after robing up in the morning, the Buddha took his bowl and robe and went to a certain family with Venerable Ānanda as his attendant.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:4.2.pli: upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi. Atha kho te manussā bhagavato ca āyasmato ca ānandassa bhojanaṃ adaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:4.2.eng: He sat down on the prepared seat, and the people there gave cooked food.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:4.3.eng: Being afraid of wrongdoing, Ānanda did not accept it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:4.5.eng: “I can’t, sir, I’m expecting another meal.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:4.6.eng: “Well then, Ānanda, assign that meal to someone else and then receive this.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:4.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—“
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:4.7.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:4.8.eng: “Monks, I allow you to eat a meal before another if you assign the other meal to someone else.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:4.9.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, vikappetabbaṃ—‘mayhaṃ bhattapaccāsaṃ itthannāmassa dammī’”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:4.9.eng: And, monks, this is how it should be assigned: ‘I give my expected meal to so-and-so.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.2.pli: pañcannaṃ bhojanānaṃ aññatarena bhojanena nimantito, taṃ ṭhapetvā aññaṃ pañcannaṃ bhojanānaṃ aññataraṃ bhojanaṃ bhuñjati, etaṃ paramparabhojanaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.2.eng: if he has been invited to eat any of the five cooked foods, and he then eats any of the five cooked foods elsewhere—this is called “eats a meal before another”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.4.eng: unless it is an appropriate occasion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.6.pli: na sakkoti ekāsane nisinno yāvadatthaṃ bhuñjituṃ. “Gilānasamayo”ti bhuñjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.6.eng: if he is not able to eat as much as he needs in one sitting, he may eat a meal before another.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.8.pli: anatthate kathine vassānassa pacchimo māso, atthate kathine pañca māsā. “Cīvaradānasamayo”ti bhuñjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.8.eng: if he has not participated in the robe-making ceremony, he may eat a meal before another during the last month of the rainy season. If he has participated in the robe-making ceremony, he may eat a meal before another during the five month period.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.8.comm: “The five month period” is the last month of the rainy season plus the four months of the cold season. “Robe-making procedure” refers to the kathina saṅghakamma, here represented by the words (an)atthate kathine .

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.9.eng: It is a time of making robes:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.10.eng: when he is making robes, he may eat a meal before another.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.11.eng: If he receives food with the intention of eating it, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.12.eng: For every mouthful swallowed, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.2.1.pli: Paramparabhojane paramparabhojanasaññī, aññatra samayā, bhuñjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.2.1.eng: If it is a meal before another, and he perceives it as such, and he eats it, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.2.2.pli: Paramparabhojane vematiko, aññatra samayā, bhuñjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.2.2.eng: If it is a meal before another, but he is unsure of it, and he eats it, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.2.3.pli: Paramparabhojane naparamparabhojanasaññī, aññatra samayā, bhuñjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.2.3.eng: If it is a meal before another, but he does not perceive it as such, and he eats it, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.2.4.eng: If it is not a meal before another, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.2.5.eng: If it is not a meal before another, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.2.6.eng: If it is not a meal before another, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.2.eng: if it is an appropriate occasion;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.3.eng: if he assigns his other meal to someone else and then eats;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.4.eng: if he eats the food from two or three invitational meals together;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.5.eng: if he eats the meals in the same order that the invitations were received;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.6.pli: sakalena gāmena nimantito tasmiṃ gāme yattha katthaci bhuñjati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.6.eng: if he is invited by a whole village and he eats anywhere in that village;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.7.pli: sakalena pūgena nimantito tasmiṃ pūge yattha katthaci bhuñjati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.7.eng: if he is invited by a whole association and he eats anywhere that belongs to that association;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.8.eng: if, when being invited, he says, “I’ll get almsfood;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.9.eng: if it is a regular meal invitation;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.10.eng: if it is a meal for which lots are drawn;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.11.eng: if it is a half-monthly meal;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.12.eng: if it is on the observance day;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.13.eng: if it is on the day after the observance day;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.14.eng: if it is anything apart from the five cooked foods;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.16.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.17.eng: The training rule on eating a meal before another, the third, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena kāṇamātā upāsikā saddhā hoti pasannā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.2.eng: At that time there was a female lay follower Kāṇamātā who had faith and confidence.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.3.pli: Kāṇā gāmake aññatarassa purisassa dinnā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.3.eng: She had a daughter, Kāṇā, who had been given in marriage to a man in a certain village.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.4.pli: Atha kho kāṇā mātugharaṃ agamāsi kenacideva karaṇīyena.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.4.eng: On one occasion Kāṇā went to her mother’s house on some business.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.5.pli: Atha kho kāṇāya sāmiko kāṇāya santike dūtaṃ pāhesi—“āgacchatu kāṇā, icchāmi kāṇāya āgatan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.5.eng: Kāṇā’s husband sent her a message: “Please come, Kāṇā, I want you back.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.6.pli: Atha kho kāṇamātā upāsikā “kismiṃ viya rittahatthaṃ gantun”ti pūvaṃ paci.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.6.eng: Kāṇamātā thought, “It’s shameful to go empty-handed,” and she baked some cookies.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.7.pli: Pakke pūve aññataro piṇḍacāriko bhikkhu kāṇamātāya upāsikāya nivesanaṃ pāvisi. Atha kho kāṇamātā upāsikā tassa bhikkhuno pūvaṃ dāpesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.7.eng: Just when the cookies were finished, an alms-collecting monk entered Kāṇamātā’s house, and she gave him some.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.8.pli: So nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi. Tassapi pūvaṃ dāpesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.8.eng: After leaving, he told another monk, and he too was given cookies.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.9.pli: So nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi. Tassapi pūvaṃ dāpesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.9.eng: And the same happened a third time.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.10.eng: At that, all the cookies were gone.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.11.pli: Dutiyampi kho kāṇāya sāmiko kāṇāya santike dūtaṃ pāhesi—“āgacchatu kāṇā, icchāmi kāṇāya āgatan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.11.eng: A second time Kāṇā’s husband sent her the same message, and everything unfolded as before.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.12.pli: Dutiyampi kho kāṇamātā upāsikā “kismiṃ viya rittahatthaṃ gantun”ti pūvaṃ paci.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.13.pli: Pakke pūve aññataro piṇḍacāriko bhikkhu kāṇamātāya upāsikāya nivesanaṃ pāvisi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.14.pli: Atha kho kāṇamātā upāsikā tassa bhikkhuno pūvaṃ dāpesi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.15.pli: So nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi. Tassapi pūvaṃ dāpesi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.16.pli: So nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi. Tassapi pūvaṃ dāpesi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.18.pli: Tatiyampi kho kāṇāya sāmiko kāṇāya santike dūtaṃ pāhesi—“āgacchatu kāṇā, icchāmi kāṇāya āgataṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.18.eng: A third time he sent the same message,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.19.pli: Sace kāṇā nāgacchissati, ahaṃ aññaṃ pajāpatiṃ ānessāmī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.19.eng: adding, “If Kāṇā doesn’t come, I’ll find another wife.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.20.pli: Tatiyampi kho kāṇamātā upāsikā kismiṃ viya rittahatthaṃ gantunti pūvaṃ paci.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.20.eng: But once again all the cookies were given to monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.21.pli: Pakke pūve aññataro piṇḍacāriko bhikkhu kāṇamātāya upāsikāya nivesanaṃ pāvisi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.22.pli: Atha kho kāṇamātā upāsikā tassa bhikkhuno pūvaṃ dāpesi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.23.pli: So nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi. Tassapi pūvaṃ dāpesi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.24.pli: So nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi. Tassapi pūvaṃ dāpesi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.26.pli: Atha kho kāṇāya sāmiko aññaṃ pajāpatiṃ ānesi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.27.pli: Assosi kho kāṇā—“tena kira purisena aññā pajāpati ānītā”ti. Sā rodantī aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.27.eng: and when Kāṇā heard what had happened, she cried.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.28.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena kāṇamātāya upāsikāya nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.28.eng: Soon afterwards, after robing up in the morning, the Buddha took his bowl and robe and went to Kāṇamātā’s house where he sat down on the prepared seat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.29.pli: Atha kho kāṇamātā upāsikā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.29.eng: Kāṇamātā approached the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.30.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho kāṇamātaraṃ upāsikaṃ bhagavā etadavoca—“kissāyaṃ kāṇā rodatī”ti? Atha kho kāṇamātā upāsikā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.30.eng: The Buddha asked her why Kāṇā was crying, and she told him what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.31.pli: Atha kho bhagavā kāṇamātaraṃ upāsikaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.31.eng: After instructing, inspiring, and gladdening her with a teaching, the Buddha got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro sattho rājagahā paṭiyālokaṃ gantukāmo hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.1.eng: Soon afterwards a certain caravan was ready to go south from Rājagaha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.2.pli: Aññataro piṇḍacāriko bhikkhu taṃ satthaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.2.eng: An alms-collecting monk went up to that caravan to get almsfood,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.3.pli: Aññataro upāsako tassa bhikkhuno sattuṃ dāpesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.3.eng: and a lay follower gave him flour products.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.3.comm: “Flour products” renders sattu. See discussion in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.4.pli: So nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi. Tassapi sattuṃ dāpesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.4.eng: After leaving, that monk told another monk, and he too was given flour products.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.5.pli: So nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi. Tassapi sattuṃ dāpesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.5.eng: And the same happened a third time.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.6.eng: At that, all his provisions were gone.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.7.pli: Atha kho so upāsako te manusse etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.7.eng: That lay follower said to the other people in the caravan,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.8.pli: “ajjaṇho, ayyā, āgametha, yathāpaṭiyattaṃ pātheyyaṃ ayyānaṃ dinnaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.8.eng: “Sirs, please wait one day. I’ve given my provisions to the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.10.eng: “We can’t wait. The caravan is already on its way.” And they left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.11.pli: Atha kho tassa upāsakassa pātheyyaṃ paṭiyādetvā pacchā gacchantassa corā acchindiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.11.eng: After preparing provisions, that lay follower followed after the caravan, but he was robbed by thieves.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.13.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā na mattaṃ jānitvā paṭiggahessanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.13.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics receive without moderation?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.14.pli: Ayaṃ imesaṃ datvā pacchā gacchanto corehi acchinno”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.14.eng: This man gave to them, and then because he was following after the caravan he was robbed by thieves.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.15.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.15.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.16.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.17.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.17.eng: Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.18.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññapessāmi dasa atthavase paṭicca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.18.eng: “Well then, monks, I will lay down a training rule for the following ten reasons:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.19.eng: for the well-being of the Sangha, for the comfort of the Sangha, for the restraint of bad people, for the ease of good monks, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to the present life, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to future lives, to give rise to confidence in those without it, to increase the confidence of those who have it, for the longevity of the true Teaching, and for supporting the training.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.20.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.20.eng: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.21.1.pli: “Bhikkhuṃ paneva kulaṃ upagataṃ pūvehi vā manthehi vā abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāreyya, ākaṅkhamānena bhikkhunā dvattipattapūrā paṭiggahetabbā tato ce uttari paṭiggaṇheyya pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.21.1.eng: ‘If a monk goes to a family and is invited to take cookies or crackers, he may accept two or three bowlfuls if he wishes. If he accepts more than that, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.22.pli: Dvattipattapūre paṭiggahetvā tato nīharitvā bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ saṃvibhajitabbaṃ. Ayaṃ tattha sāmīcī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.22.eng: If he accepts two or three bowlfuls, he should take it away and share it with the monks. This is the proper procedure.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.1.eng: A monk goes to a family:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.2.pli: kulaṃ nāma cattāri kulāni—khattiyakulaṃ, brāhmaṇakulaṃ, vessakulaṃ, suddakulaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.2.eng: a family: there are four kinds of families: the aristocratic family, the brahmin family, the merchant family, the worker family.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.6.eng: whatever has been prepared for the purpose of sending away.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.6.comm: “Cookies” renders pūva. See discussion in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.8.eng: whatever has been prepared as provisions for a journey.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.8.comm: “Crackers” renders mantha. See discussion in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.13.eng: He may accept two or three bowlfuls:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.14.eng: two or three bowlfuls can be accepted.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.15.eng: If he accepts more than that:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.16.eng: when he accepts more than that, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.17.eng: If he accepts two or three bowlfuls:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.18.pli: tato nikkhamantena bhikkhuṃ passitvā ācikkhitabbaṃ—“amutra mayā dvattipattapūrā paṭiggahitā, mā kho tattha paṭiggaṇhī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.18.eng: leaving that place and seeing a monk, he should tell him, “I’ve accepted two or three bowlfuls from such-and-such a place; don’t accept anything from there.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.19.pli: Sace passitvā na ācikkhati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.19.eng: If he sees a monk, but does not tell him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.20.eng: If the one who is told accepts from there regardless, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.20.comm: That is, the one who is told commits the offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.21.eng: He should take it away and share it with the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.22.eng: he should take it away when returning from almsround and then share it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.2.1.eng: If it is more than two or three bowlfuls, and he perceives it as more, and he accepts it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.2.2.eng: If it is more than two or three bowlfuls, but he is unsure of it, and he accepts it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.2.3.eng: If it is more than two or three bowlfuls, but he perceives it as less, and he accepts it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.2.4.eng: If it is less than two or three bowlfuls, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.2.5.eng: If it is less than two or three bowlfuls, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.2.6.eng: If it is less than two or three bowlfuls, and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.2.eng: if he accepts two or three bowlfuls;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.3.eng: if he accepts less than two or three bowlfuls;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.4.pli: na paheṇakatthāya na pātheyyatthāya paṭiyattaṃ denti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.4.eng: if they give anything that has not been prepared for sending away or as provisions for a journey;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.5.pli: paheṇakatthāya vā pātheyyatthāya vā paṭiyattasesakaṃ denti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.5.eng: if they give the leftovers from what was prepared for sending away or as provisions for a journey;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.6.eng: if they give after the plans to travel have been canceled;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.8.eng: if it is from those who have given an invitation;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.9.eng: if it is for the benefit of someone else;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.10.eng: if it is by means of his own property;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.12.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.13.eng: The training rule on Kāṇamātā, the fourth, is finished.
